title: Ex–Toly Arutunoff 1959 Lancia Appia GTE Zagato
description: This 1959 Lancia Appia GTE Zagato was distributed new through Max Hoffman in New York before being purchased by the former owner, Anatoly Arutunoff, in the early 1970s and driven in the inaugural Copperstate 1000, the Mitty, the Monterey Historics, and other events across the US. Chassis 2533 was sold by Mr. Arutunoff on BaT in September 2021 and brought to Canada, where it was acquired by the seller in 2023. Subsequent work involved re-trimming the seats in leather along with performing an engine tune-up, fitting a custom exhaust system, and dry ice cleaning the underside. The car features aluminum Zagato bodywork finished in white over a white and blue interior and is powered by a 1.1-liter V4 fitted with a single Weber carburetor and a four-into-one header. Shifting is through a four-speed manual transmission, and further details include covered headlights, a sliding-pillar front suspension, and 15" steel wheels along with a wood-rimmed Nardi steering wheel and Veglia instrumentation. Previously listed on BaT in November 2024, this Appia GTE Zagato is offered again in Canada with a FIVA identity card, catalogs and vehicle literature, records dating back to the 1970s, spare and removed parts, and Alberta registration in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a Ex–Toly Arutunoff 1959 Lancia Appia GTE Zagato at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #175,214.
